author: Staff Reporter
text:
A special camp to provide loans to youth under the Unemployed Youth Employment Generation Programme (UYEGP) would be held at the District Industries Centre on January 27 at 10.30 a.m.

Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy in a press release said that after the recent rain, many districts were affected in the State. Since the loss was extensive, the State Government announced that all the districts in the State were affected and issued a government order. The Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) sector suffered huge loss and the Chief Minister announced loan of up to Rs. 5 lakh to the unemployed youth in the flood-affected districts apart from subsidy of 25 per cent in the capital. Also, loan of Rs. 3 lakh and Rs. 1 lakh would be provided for starting of units, service or trading activities.

Hence, educated unemployed youth can utilise the opportunity to become entrepreneurs for which selection programme would be held at the District Industries Centre. Youth who have completed 18 years of age and passed in Standard VIII are eligible to participate in the selection programme. They should appear with two copies of their certificates for educational qualification, ration card or elector identity card along with originals. They need to fill in the application form on Wednesday and selection process will be completed immediately.

They can also contact, General Manager, District Industries Centre, Collectorate premises or at 04286-281151, 281251.
title: Special camp for youth
